notesStmt.note: Staining and water damage throughout, in patches.
Ink falking in parts, with losses of text.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 35; ruled lines: 50 51; written lines: 50 51; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point. Visible pricking and stiching of membranes. 35 columns in total, one to six columns per membrane. No tagin on letters. In some fragments ח is arched. Special shapes of letters occur: the inverted נ placed before and after Num. 10:35-36, פ' לפוף is frequent. Columns generally begin with a new verse. Several instances of majuscular and minuscular letters. The "puncta extraordinaria" placed on the words fixed by masorah.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental square script of the 15th century.
